Some memos are deemed too important to just e-mail to faculty. Feb 20, 2006

Fu Laoshi

Titles are very important in Taiwanese society. It is incredibly impolite to call someone by their given name, unless you are close friends or colleagues. Even then a nickname might be more common among friends and surname-plus-title among colleagues. Another option is to say the full name: surname + given name. My Chinese name is Fu Ke-en (傅可恩...
